attributes.action: Restore Cromwell Avenue traffic lights to a roundabout
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
in 2007 Warrington council replaced a perfectly good roundabout with a set of traffic lights to allow for a pedestrian crossing despite their being very little pedestrain use in that area.
Since then there has been traffic chaos, additional spending to correct and now they are suggesting aditional lanes to correct their mistake instead of holding their hands up and restoring to original condition.

described by the local newspaper as a £700,000 cockup 

"Warrington Borough Council has announced it is to spend £150,000 on work at the Cromwell Avenue and Westbrook Crescent junction. Taxpayers have already forked out £535,000 on the controversial scheme."
